reviewText: Good Hidden Objects, with good puzzles in between hidden object scenes. Done simple, but very well. The less hints you use the more points you get. Also if you find skip tokens you can use them to skip the puzzles if you get stuck. The characters are funny and so are their voices. You get to pick a character out of several, and you must travel place to place in a village. It is just a really good hidden object game. I always have trouble finding the last few oblects, because they are hidden so well. I love that. It is just simple but really well done. I will finish this game, and really enjoy it.
voteText: 28 of 30 people (93%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This is a decent HOG with a western theme. If you played Al Emmo the Lost Dutch Mine, you will be familiar with things here. if not, that's okay. The game works as a stand alone experience too. You start out by selecting one of five playable characters. I thought this was a nice touch, as each character has different things to say and their own audio speech for every postcard collected. Game play involves finding a list of random objects in each scene before the timer expires. Along the way you can find different types of tokens to assist your game. Points tokens, time increase tokens, and skip puzzle tokens. There are 29 levels to solve and 29 postcards to collect from completing scenes at various locations.

PROS:
*Nice colorful scenes
*A large variety of hidden objects
*5 playable characters, individually voiced. Good replay value
*With 29 levels, it's quite a large game
*There's a relaxed game mode without a timer

CONS:

*At times certain objects were hard to see
*On a few rare occassions there were some doubled objects in a scene (like 2 coffee cups) but only one of them would register as the correct object.
*Resolution could be higher, but I suppose this is a limit of the AGS engine.
*Some non-HOG puzzles may grow a little tedious (Find the Differences puzzles)
voteText: 11 of 11 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game has many flaws, but is still of good value to hardcore hidden-object game lovers, especially those who enjoy the world of Al Emmo.

There is no point-and-click adventuring, and the puzzles aren't especially challenging or interesting. The hidden object scenes are plagued with stylistic incoherence, low-rez objects that barely look like what they're supposed to be, and repetition.

However... there are a lot of hidden-object scenes, enough content to keep you busy for a good few hours. Again, if you don't absolutely love such games, you will likely hate this one.

I played as Koko, and can't get enough of him! He's hilarious!
voteText: 11 of 11 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Al Emmo's Postcards from Anozira is a bit dated, but should be ok for any kids who are into puzzles - or for any adults who like that sort of thing as well, I guess.

The graphics aren't perfect; as I mentioned, it is a bit dated, but if you can overlook that, then it's fine.

Several types of games are included, for example:
- Hidden object games
- Jigsaw puzzles
- Tile slide puzzles

If memory serves me correctly, I picked it up when it was on special.
The retail price is about $5, so if you get it on special for 90% off (50 cents), you're not risking much.

If you like puzzles, and don't mind the game being dated, then go ahead and buy it.
However, my recommendation is to buy it when it's on sale, as I don't think it is worth paying full price for this game.

reviewText: It's a worst game of its type. I clicked on a toe mound of a footprint. It didn't work, so I clicked again. I got punished by removing a small amount of time. I tried to click another area...heel. It worked. Ha. In a list, it wanted me to find grapes, there were three or four clusters look similar to grapes. I clicked on a green one, it failed, so I clicked on red or something, it failed, I clicked on a purple or something one, it worked. Maybe they didn't know that grapes come in different colors. I was also supposed to find a moth. It was tiny and sand colored on slightly darker sand soil. The game is somewhat low resolution.

reviewText: I can't say it's great game. It was in bundle, so I paid about 0,30€ - not so bad. But the game is bad and ugly.
